title: Why is the foaming capacity of soap more in soft water than in hard water? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you add the same amount of soap in equal volume of soft water and hard water, you will get less foam in hard water. This is because the soap reacts with the calcium and magnesium ions in hard water and forms calcium and magnesium soaps. These are insoluble in water and gets deposited as scum. So part of the soap will not be available to make foam. Less available soap means less foam.

In hard water there are salts of calcium and magnesium in which when soap is added it is precipitated as calcium carbonate or magnesium hydroxide as results hard water has less foaming capacity as compare to soft water.
